programme.desc: Germaine Greer and Jermaine Jenas - together at last. Pointless co-host Richard Osman and QI's Alan Davies also join the hit fact-or-fiction panel show. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert's Extra Mile Compilation 1: Rhod Gilbert presents a selection of some of the funniest and most dramatic moments from recent series of the programme.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the devilishly fun panel show in which stars swap plausible porkies and far-fetched facts. With Richard Hammond, Sean Lock, Trevor Noah - and Judy Murray.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from Home.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets
programme.desc: Restaurant Revelations: The Bikers create a restaurant-quality meal on the tightest of budgets and pick up some foraging tips.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Best Of: Hot Rod Treasures: Mike and Frank hit the road - and the track - while flagging down some deals on race cars and memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Bubba Gump Pickers: Mike and Frank head to South Carolina and come across a mammoth collection of militaria that includes Civil War revolvers and Forrest Gump's original footlocker.

programme.title: Our Guy in India
programme.desc: Guy Martin clambers up India's tallest building and has his preconceptions about slums challenged in Mumbai before heading to Goa and the Rider Mania motorbike race.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The rucking great motoring show. Jeremy and James enjoy a game of rugby without leaving their driving seats, and Lewis Hamilton swaps his F1 wheels for a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: More motoring mayhem. Jeremy and Richard tackle the interconnected issues of an ageing population and the complexity of modern cars by designing a vehicle for pensioners.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Alton: The cut-throat auction show that's 'lots' of fun. Things escalate between Nat and Boudicca. There are explosive consequences when Scotty fails to read a warning sign!

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Hull: More auction antics as salvage supremos fight over lumber on the Humber. Nat can't cope with both voodoo magic and Heavy D. Luckily, Sean has an emergency vehicle to hand!

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Hampshire: Babbling Sean Kelly is the auction host with the most on the south coast, where an uplifting prize gets the offers rolling. John gives Nat flak for blind bidding.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Carmarthen: Auction anarchy in Wales, where the bidders hope to get rich quick by bagging valuable storage lots. It's cloak-and-dagger stuff as spying equipment is on offer.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Food and Religion: The Bikers explore the relationship between food and faith - dishes include Simnel cake and beef brisket, and they also find out more about hot cross buns.

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Food and the Empire: The Bikers explore the impact Britain's colonial past has on food, from chai in bread and butter pudding to India pale ale in sausage casserole.

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The second leg of Simon Reeve's journey around the Caribbean Sea takes him from the beautiful island of Barbados to St Vincent and the Grenadines, Venezuela and Colombia.

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon's last leg begins on the remote Caribbean coast of Nicaragua before he encounters extreme violence on the mainland of Honduras and finishes his adventure on Jamaica.

programme.title: Bradford on Duty
programme.desc: Healthy at Home: This episode examines how the NHS is trying to relieve pressure on hospitals by caring for patients in their own homes.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Gaby Roslin and Tinchy Stryder - together at last. Jack Dee and Romesh Ranganathan also join the regulars for the very witty fact-or-fiction panel show. Rob Brydon hosts.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You

programme.title: QI

programme.desc: The Boyfriend Complexity: When Penny's father visits, Leonard discovers that her parents still think that he and Penny are a couple, so he takes advantage of the situation.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Alien Parasite Hypothesis: Amy realises that she has romantic feelings for Zack. Raj and Howard compete to prove who would make the better superhero.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Justice League Recombination: The guys slowly warm to Zack and find an enjoyable way to bond with him when they enter a New Year's Eve fancy dress competition together.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Bus Pants Utilization: Leonard and Sheldon fight for control of an idea for an app.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Love Car Displacement: Howard feels threatened when Bernadette runs into her hulk of an ex-boyfriend at a science conference.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe Baby Blues: Moe becomes Maggie's babysitter after saving her from a car accident when he was about to end it all. She gives him a reason to live, but Homer isn't happy.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Sex, Pies and Idiot Scrapes: Homer and Flanders become bounty hunters. Marge gets a job at an erotic bakery.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Burger Kings: Mr Burns gets into the plant-based burger business. But Lisa is convinced that he has an ulterior motive.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Panic on the Streets of Springfield: Lisa develops an imaginary friendship with a morose British singer. Homer gets a powerful truck.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Man from G.R.A.M.P.A.: A British secret agent comes to Springfield on the trail of a Russian spy. Guest starring Stephen Fry.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Last Barfighter: A secret society of bartenders seek vengeance on Homer and his friends after Moe breaks their most sacred rule.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Treehouse of Horror VII: Bart finds his evil twin in the attic, Lisa becomes God to a race of tiny people, and Kang and Kodos assume the identities of Bill Clinton and Bob Dole.

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: (2009) JJ Abrams's sci-fi adventure reboot, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Zoe Saldana. A vengeful time traveller targets Kirk and Spock on their first mission.

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: This time the celebs watch Casualty, The 1% Club for Soccer Aid, Clarkson's Farm, Heretic, The Yorkshire Vet: At Home with the Greens, This Morning and ITV News (Trump v Musk).

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On the 'Box this time: Casualty, Queer Eye, Below Deck Sailing Yacht, FUBAR, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment, Big Beasts and BBC News (Phillip Schofield).

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The Goggleboxers have been watching: Sitting on a Fortune, Casualty, Britain's Got Talent, MerPeople, James May: Oh Cook!, The Greatest Auction and Top of the Pops 1994.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A tattooist who loves to shoot, a gym bunny, a cheesemaker and a multilingual entrepreneur who loves a man in a suit are all looking for love on their first date.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Farmer Chris brings a beetroot to his first date. Two dog fans commiserate over past loves. And football coach Timi flirts up a storm - but will student Afope flirt back?

programme.title: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Drifting Standards: A deckhand and guest drift too far away at sea, leaving Captain Sandy questioning her bosun. A guest complains about the food.

programme.title: Below Deck Mediterranean
programme.desc: Greeking Havoc: The deck team leap into action to salvage a chaotic beach picnic. Meanwhile, romance begins to blossom between more than two crew members.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Vacation: Beverly marshals everyone for one last family vacation to Disneyland. Erica worries that Geoff wants to break up. Guest starring Christie Brinkley.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Dana's Back: Adam gets a blast from the past in the shape of Dana - his first love. Meanwhile, Erica and Barry are heading to college with nowhere to live.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Food in a Geoffy: Murray and Geoff have to run around Jenkintown looking for an important cheese steak after a food delivery job goes sideways.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Animal House: While Barry's love of Animal House fails to impress an elite fraternity, Beverly tries to convince Murray to take up new hobbies.

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Mercedes confronts the person who she believes killed Bobby, and says an emotional goodbye at his funeral. Meanwhile, Prince gets upsetting news. And a threat stops Sienna in her tracks...

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Sebastian's: Gordon Ramsay visits Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Los Angeles. The customers are scarce and the debt is mounting. Can Gordon turn the restaurant's fortunes around?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Finn McCool's: Gordon Ramsay visits Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, where the family feuding has got out of hand. Can Gordon mediate?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The Olde Stone Mill: Gordon Ramsay visits The Olde Stone Mill in Tuckahoe, New York. The restaurant has been restored, but owner Dean can't get customers through the door.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: La Frite: In Los Angeles, Gordon Ramsay visits La Frite, a French restaurant that's being run into the ground by its squabbling family owners.

programme.title: Junior Bake Off
programme.desc: In this compilation episode, the second heat of junior bakers make dream cakes, the world's worst inventions in biscuit and musical-inspired pastry. Whose choux got through to Finals Week?

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Thespian Catalyst: Sheldon lectures at the university but worries that the students don't seem to like him. Raj fantasises about his best friend's girlfriend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Benefactor Factor: A wealthy benefactor at the university makes Leonard consider how far he's willing to go in the name of science.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Cohabitation Formulation: Howard is torn between taking things to the next level with Bernadette and pleasing his mother. Leonard rekindles his relationship with Priya.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Toast Derivation: Sheldon is surprised and disturbed to find out that it's really Leonard who is at the centre of their group of friends and not him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Prestidigitation Approximation: Leonard must choose between his new girlfriend Priya and his friendship with Penny. Howard drives Sheldon crazy with a magic trick.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: (1998) Elijah Wood and Morgan Freeman star in the sci-fi disaster movie about impending meteorite-related disaster, attempts to destroy it, and possibly some cataclysmic havoc.

programme.title: New: Lego Masters Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series - What's in Store?: The teams are challenged to fill a real shop window with an attention-grabbing Lego showstopper. Whose display will have a captive audience?

programme.title: The Simpsons: Abso-diddly!
programme.desc: Left Behind: Flanders loses his job and comes to work with Homer at the power plant. Homer prays for him to be fired.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Abso-diddly!
programme.desc: Hurricane Neddy: The Flanders' home is blown down by a hurricane and the Leftorium is looted. Homer leads the rebuilding project, but will Ned be happy with his new house?

programme.title: The Simpsons: Abso-diddly!
programme.desc: The Monkey Suit: Ned is horrified by an evolution exhibition and asks Reverend Lovejoy to promote creationism. So Lisa arranges secret evolution classes...

programme.title: The Simpsons: Abso-diddly!
programme.desc: Bart Has Two Mommies: Marge babysits Rod and Todd, but Ned overreacts when she lets them play on a climbing wall. Bart gets pulled into a chimp cage at the zoo.

programme.title: The Simpsons: Abso-diddly!
programme.desc: Ned 'n' Edna's Blend: Marge offers to host Ned and Edna's secret wedding.

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: (2018) Dark sci-fi action with Tom Hardy as Marvel's anti-hero. A reporter becomes inhabited by a ferocious extraterrestrial that has its own ideas on how to behave. With Michelle Williams.

programme.title: Nope
programme.desc: (2022) Western-infused sci-fi chiller with Daniel Kaluuya and Keke Palmer as cash-strapped horse trainers who try to supplement their income by filming alien goings-on at their ranch.

programme.title: Ready or Not
programme.desc: (2019) Wickedly funny comedy horror starring Samara Weaving. A bride finds herself being hunted down by her new in-laws when she is asked to observe a deadly family tradition.

programme.title: Pet Sematary
programme.desc: (2019) Horror based on Stephen King's novel. Seeking a quiet life, a family moves to a rural setting. But there's a road with speeding trucks and a pet cemetery that resurrects the dead...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Seeker: The Dark Is Rising
programme.desc: (2007) Supernatural thriller. Alexander Ludwig stars as The Seeker, who has the task of finding six items hidden throughout time, which the scary forces of The Dark are also looking for.

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of...
programme.desc: ...Unfortunate Events: (2004) Gothic family comedy starring Jim Carrey as the evil, scheming Count Olaf, who'll do whatever it takes to deprive three young orphans of their inheritance.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: (1989) Comedy-thriller starring Tom Hanks. A cop investigates a murder to which there's just one witness: Hooch, a slobbering, beer-drinking French mastiff, who now needs 24/7 protection.

programme.title: Mysterious Island
programme.desc: (1961) Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel. Two men fleeing the US Civil War find an island inhabited by monsters (animated by Ray Harryhausen) and the mysterious Captain Nemo.

programme.title: 13 Going on 30
programme.desc: (2004) Breezy body-swap romcom. Following a disastrous birthday party, teen Jenna wishes she was '30, flirty and thriving'. And boom, she's Jennifer Garner with a fancy flat and a cool job.

programme.title: Darkman
programme.desc: (1990) Liam Neeson and Frances McDormand star in Sam Raimi's crime-fighting action-fantasy. A scientist uses his invention to seek revenge on his attackers.

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: (2020) Fighty, satirical horror that upset Donald Trump. Hilary Swank plays a rich lefty who likes hunting working class people to the death. But she didn't reckon on Betty Gilpin.

programme.title: Under the Skin
programme.desc: (2013) Surreal sci-fi horror with Scarlett Johansson. An alien who's adopted the guise of a beautiful woman roams Glasgow, using her looks to lure men to an unspeakable fate.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Playing with Fire
programme.desc: (2019) Fun-filled family comedy starring John Cena. A macho fireman has to babysit three impish kids after saving them from a blaze in the remote California woodlands.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: (2012) Quirky animated family comedy with the voices of Adam Sandler and Selena Gomez. Count Dracula runs a secluded hotel as a haven for monsters, but his daughter wants to see the world.

programme.title: Baby's Day Out
programme.desc: (1994) Comedy starring Joe Mantegna, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley. Inept criminals kidnap a millionaire's baby. But when the boy escapes, there's mayhem as they try to track him down.

programme.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
programme.desc: (1997) Romcom with Julia Roberts and Cameron Diaz. Is it okay for a girl to wreck a wedding because she only realises she loves a guy when he tells her he's getting married to someone else?

programme.title: I, Robot
programme.desc: (2004) Sci-fi thriller with Will Smith. In 2035, a technophobic cop investigates a crime that may have been perpetrated by a robot. Can he keep an open mind?

programme.title: Monster Hunter
programme.desc: (2020) Paul WS Anderson's sci-fi action starring Milla Jovovich, based on the game of the same name. A US Army Ranger must fight her way out of a parallel world full of monsters.

programme.title: X
programme.desc: (2022) Ti West's acclaimed grindhouse horror with Mia Goth. Some adult filmmakers inexplicably choose a ramshackle house in the Bible-Belt wilderness to shoot a film. It's gonna get nasty.

programme.title: Sightseers
programme.desc: (2012) Ben Wheatley's dark and violent comedy-drama stars Alice Lowe and Steve Oram as lovers whose initially innocent tour of the British countryside turns into a disturbing odyssey.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: One Million Years B.C.
programme.desc: (1966) Raquel Welch - in her famous fur bikini - stars in this prehistoric adventure set in an inhospitable landscape populated by two warring tribes and Ray Harryhausen's roving dinosaurs.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania 2
programme.desc: (2015) Animated family comedy sequel. Mavis (Selena Gomez) and Johnny (Andy Samberg) leave baby Dennis with 'Vampa' Dracula (Adam Sandler), who organises a monster boot camp.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: (2020) Madcap adventure-comedy video game adaptation with Jim Carrey and Ben Schwartz. Can nippy ring-chasing hedgehog Sonic escape the clutches of an evil, moustachioed scientist?

programme.title: Starman
programme.desc: (1984) John Carpenter's sci-fi romance with Jeff Bridges and Karen Allen. An alien is stranded on Earth, where he assumes the form of a widow's dead husband - and finds the locals hostile.

programme.title: The Lighthouse Interview Special
programme.desc: Actors Willem Dafoe and Robert Pattinson talk to Film4 about going to extremes in the eerie drama from the director of The Witch, Robert Eggers.

programme.title: Taxi
programme.desc: (2004) All-action thriller. Queen Latifah stars as the driver of the fastest taxi in New York, who teams up with an inept cop (Jimmy Fallon) to catch a team of female bank-robbers.

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: (2021) Jason Statham reunites with director Guy Ritchie to give it both barrels as a mysterious hardman working for a money truck firm that keeps getting hit. But is he an inside man?

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: (2011) Fantasy action-adventure. Jason Momoa stars as Conan, who sets out to kill the evil warlord who massacred his village when he was young. With Stephen Lang and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: Nope
programme.desc: (2022) Western-infused sci-fi chiller with Daniel Kaluuya and Keke Palmer as cash-strapped horse trainers who try to supplement their income by filming alien goings-on at their ranch.

programme.title: Starman

programme.title: Taxi

programme.title: Wrath of Man
programme.desc: (2021) Jason Statham reunites with director Guy Ritchie to give it both barrels as a mysterious hardman working for a money truck firm that keeps getting hit. But is he an inside man?

programme.title: Press Preview

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: Only five pairs remain as things turn frosty with a Hotel Game like no other. Guests pick ice lollies with unexpected flavours and even more unexpected consequences. While some sticks spell safety, others hand players a power to target their rivals. Later, it's off to the historic streets of St George's for a high-energy Day Trip Challenge involving hotel staff and a well-known phrase

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by Italian chef Gennaro Contaldo, who is served a full English breakfast loaf and gives the hosts a lesson in whittling. Vet Henry checks up on some new arrivals at the wildlife park in the form of of baby maras and Max makes copper coat hooks in the workshop

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: Still in Hampshire, James views ex-formula one racer Jody Scheckter's epic car collection, and learns of his passion for buffalo mozzarella, which he makes in his dairy. James uses some of the cheese in his buffalo mozzarella, blackberry and beetroot salad, before crossing into Sussex to don fancy dress and experience the Goodwood Revival, which celebrates motorsport from the 1940s to the 1960s. The presenter offers a classic comfort recipe - roast pork with black pudding fritters and caramelised apples as he prepares to watch some of his friends race in the Goodwood Revival TT race

programme.title: ITV Lunchtime News
programme.desc: The key headlines from the day so far

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from York
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of day three of the Ebor Meeting, featuring the 3.35 Coolmore Wootton Bassett Nunthorpe Stakes and races at 1.50, 2.25, 3.00 and 4.10. With analysis from Jason Weaver, Adele Mulrennan and Ruby Walsh, reports by Oli Bell, Mick Fitzgerald and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Dave from Leyland, Kate from London, Tina from Nottingham and Devesh from Hertfordshire take on a Chaser. Bradley Walsh guides the contestants through a battle of wits in the hope they'll go home with thousands of pounds

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast

programme.title: ITV Evening News
programme.desc: A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world

programme.title: What's on Scotland
programme.desc: Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas comforts an anxious Charity, who is upset how she left things with Mack, while Moira forms a plan and things are awkward in the cafe

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy confirms her suspicions of Carl and Abi, Carla gives Sarah a hard time, Brody reveals the outcome of Lou's sentencing, and Aadi announces that he is making a fresh start

programme.title: Under the Bridge
programme.desc: The unfolding trial pushes Rebecca to the brink as she begins to question who she should defend, and Cam's allegiance to the justice system is tested as details from the night of the murder are finally revealed

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Under the Bridge
programme.desc: The last opportunity for justice arrives as all the participants consider their true involvement in the events that transpired and a radical choice of forgiveness allows for closure

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: Would-be writer Simone has finally written the one story she could never get out of her mind and her debut book One Night is about to be published. However it soon becomes clear that the devastating story told does not exclusively belong to her. Australian drama, starring Nicole da Silva, Jodie Whittaker and Yael Stone

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by actress Hayley Tamaddon for a space hopper race, hairdresser Michael Douglas and make-up artist Genevieve Turley transform another charity advocate, and Aldo Zilli serves up delicious drinks

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley makes some dishes with hearty vegetables, starting with his chicken and spring vegetable casserole. Joseph lends a hand at the pea harvest in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Craig from Glasgow, David from London, Jo from Cheshire and Anoushka from Surrey pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne, Jordan North, Shaun Wright-Phillips, Hugh Dennis and Kelly Hoppen take on one another in the show's first-ever six-way cooking battle. The contestants have to deliver a British classic using only air fryers in just 30 minutes, with the bottom two having to cook more speedy dishes in a bid to secure a place in the quarter-final

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by 2016 Great British Bake Off winner Candice Brown for a baked breakfast of a berry slump. Jimmy meets Charles the iguana while he is out for a walk at the wildlife park, and Suffolk local Nicola gives a masterclass in fermenting by showing some unusual combinations

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is joined by singer Louise Redknapp while tasting mouth-watering recipes from chefs Francesco Mazzei and Tom Shepherd and cooking nettles with forager Alysia Greenwood.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the rich and aromatic flavours of South Asia, with his first dish being vada pav, a speciality from Mumbai consisting of a spicy fluffy potato patty that is battered and fried and served up with a selection of chutneys. Lisa Snowdon meets the team at Mr Bombay to find out about the tasty treats they serve up to marketgoers and cooks a lamb curry, while actress Donna Preston makes a vegetarian dish of spiced paneer skewers with mango salad

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef journeys from Extremadura to Murcia in his vintage food truck as he heads out on Lake Orellena to discover secret spots that are best for catching crayfish. He also cooks up a celebration of an ultimate take on a crayfish cocktail. Tom's journey then takes him to Murcia, where local producer Shelley shows him what it takes to harvest the Piel de Sapo, a melon loved in Spain and gaining popularity in the UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from York
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of the fourth and final day of the Ebor Festival, including the 3.35 Sky Bet Ebor, plus races at 1.50, 2.25, 3.00 and 4.10. Plus, racing from Goodwood. With analysis from Jason Weaver, Adele Mulrennan and Ruby Walsh, reports by Oli Bell, Mick Fitzgerald and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure sequel starring Eddie Redmayne. Newt Scamander is tasked with tracking down a dangerously powerful young wizard who has fled to Paris. Meanwhile, dark wizard Gellert Grindelwald has escaped custody and is travelling Europe in search of followers.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp, Craig Charles and Sam Quek attempt to answer 15 questions correctly in the hope of winning one million pounds for charity. They have lifelines including Ask the Host, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: One Night
programme.desc: After discovering that Simone's book is not purely a work of fiction, Hat grows nervous about the secrets it exposes and the repercussions of keeping the truth from Tess. Australian drama, starring Jodie Whittaker, Yael Stone and Helen Thomson

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at more of the most memorable moments from recent series, including interviews with Britney Spears, Ed Sheeran, Steve Carell, Goldie Hawn, Michael Buble, Mel B, Robbie Williams, Lewis Capaldi and Judi Love

programme.title: English Football League Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the latest matches, including Charlton Athletic v Leicester City at The Valley, Wrexham v Sheffield Wednesday at StoK Racecourse and Norwich City v Middlesbrough at Carrow Road in the Championship

programme.title: The Twelve
programme.desc: Claire's father, Nathan Spears, is called to the stand, painting Kate as a sexual predator who groomed Claire before murdering her. Colby throws suspicion back onto Nathan when it's revealed that he had a false online persona and posed as a young girl in order to monitor Claire's social media

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Fern Britton: Inside the Vet's
programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. In this episode, cameras follow the vets and nursing staff who have welcomed Fern into their practice while she assists in the completion of doggy dentistry on a spaniel. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott celebrates everything the sea and the seaside has to offer, making harissa-crusted cod with a quick chickpea, spinach and tomato stew, a spicy crab salad, and chargrilled chilli-lime pineapple. Meanwhile, Joseph Denison Carey learns about the fascinating world of seaweed and goes on a surprising picnic

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is joined by singer Louise Redknapp while tasting mouth-watering recipes from chefs Francesco Mazzei and Tom Shepherd and cooking nettles with forager Alysia Greenwood.

programme.title: Katie Piper's Weekend Escape
programme.desc: Katie is joined by comedians Paul Merton and Suki Webster, while Michael Douglas and Genevieve Turley transform a charity trustee, and JJ Goodman serves up drinks

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Sue Barker discusses her life both on and off the tennis court, while actor Adrian Lukis talks about returning to his Mr Wickham roots. Plus, the programme joins the royal family at the Braemar Gathering, and celebrates the very best in autumnal wines in today's Best of British

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the rich and aromatic flavours of South Asia, with his first dish being vada pav, a speciality from Mumbai consisting of a spicy fluffy potato patty that is battered and fried and served up with a selection of chutneys. Lisa Snowdon meets the team at Mr Bombay to find out about the tasty treats they serve up to marketgoers and cooks a lamb curry, while actress Donna Preston makes a vegetarian dish of spiced paneer skewers with mango salad

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team set to work transforming a deserving young family's inaccessible and uninspiring garden in Dudley in the West Midlands. The team decide to create a Mediterranean-style garden with a cool contemporary edge and bold design features, which captures the family's favourite holiday destination of Malta

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: About a Boy
programme.desc: Romantic comedy drama based on the novel by Nick Hornby, starring Hugh Grant as womanising 30-something Will. In search of easy conquests, Will poses as a father at a picnic for single parents where he meets the emotionally troubled Fiona and her 12-year-old son, Marcus.

programme.title: Never Say Never Again
programme.desc: Spy adventure starring Sean Connery and Klaus Maria Brandauer. James Bond comes out of retirement and finds himself having to get back into shape to confront archenemies Blofeld and Largo, and foil a plot to hold the world to ransom using nuclear weapons.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Rachel, Karim, Ru and Dylan pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne and Kelly Hoppen try to impress with family favourite dishes in a three-way cooking battle. The second contest sees Jordan North go up against Shaun Wright-Phillips in a bid to secure a place in the semi-final, with the stars who fail to impress heading into the dreaded cook-off

programme.title: Ridley
programme.desc: When a body is discovered at an illegal rave, Ridley and the investigative team are thrust into a high-profile case as victim Oliver Grant emerges as the heir apparent to his family's property empire and poised to become its next CEO. As they inch closer to uncovering the truth behind Oliver's murder, the juxtaposition of the corporate world, the underground rave scene and Ridley's personal struggles weaves a gripping tale of mysterious intrigue

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Gary Oldman, Jason Clarke and Andy Serkis. With most of the human population wiped out, the world is now ruled by super-intelligent apes. But their chimp leader Caesar finds his loyalties divided when a small band of human survivors strike back.

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Sci-fi action adventure starring James Franco and Freida Pinto. When scientist Will Rodman's programme of drug experiments to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease is shut down he secretly takes an offspring from one of the chimpanzees he was using into his home and names him Caesar. Caesar has inherited the effects of the trial drug and begins to show remarkable intelligence, a development that will put him on a violent collision course with the humans who have abused him.

programme.title: The Fortune Hotel
programme.desc: Only five pairs remain as things turn frosty with a Hotel Game like no other. Guests pick ice lollies with unexpected flavours and even more unexpected consequences. While some sticks spell safety, others hand players a power to target their rivals. Later, it's off to the historic streets of St George's for a high-energy Day Trip Challenge involving hotel staff and a well-known phrase

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by Italian chef Gennaro Contaldo, who is served a full English breakfast loaf and gives the hosts a lesson in whittling. Vet Henry checks up on some new arrivals at the wildlife park in the form of of baby maras and Max makes copper coat hooks in the workshop

programme.title: This Morning

programme.title: James Martin's Great British Adventure
programme.desc: Still in Hampshire, James views ex-formula one racer Jody Scheckter's epic car collection, and learns of his passion for buffalo mozzarella, which he makes in his dairy. James uses some of the cheese in his buffalo mozzarella, blackberry and beetroot salad, before crossing into Sussex to don fancy dress and experience the Goodwood Revival, which celebrates motorsport from the 1940s to the 1960s. The presenter offers a classic comfort recipe - roast pork with black pudding fritters and caramelised apples as he prepares to watch some of his friends race in the Goodwood Revival TT race

programme.title: Ainsley's Good Mood Food
programme.desc: Ainsley makes some dishes with hearty vegetables, starting with his chicken and spring vegetable casserole. Joseph lends a hand at the pea harvest in Lincolnshire.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Craig from Glasgow, David from London, Jo from Cheshire and Anoushka from Surrey pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Cooking with the Stars
programme.desc: Emma Willis and Tom Allen host as Natalie Cassidy, Jack Osbourne, Jordan North, Shaun Wright-Phillips, Hugh Dennis and Kelly Hoppen take on one another in the show's first-ever six-way cooking battle. The contestants have to deliver a British classic using only air fryers in just 30 minutes, with the bottom two having to cook more speedy dishes in a bid to secure a place in the quarter-final

programme.title: Jimmy & Shivi's Farmhouse Breakfast
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined by 2016 Great British Bake Off winner Candice Brown for a baked breakfast of a berry slump. Jimmy meets Charles the iguana while he is out for a walk at the wildlife park, and Suffolk local Nicola gives a masterclass in fermenting by showing some unusual combinations

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is back in the kitchen and is joined by singer Louise Redknapp while tasting mouth-watering recipes from chefs Francesco Mazzei and Tom Shepherd and cooking nettles with forager Alysia Greenwood.

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott explores the rich and aromatic flavours of South Asia, with his first dish being vada pav, a speciality from Mumbai consisting of a spicy fluffy potato patty that is battered and fried and served up with a selection of chutneys. Lisa Snowdon meets the team at Mr Bombay to find out about the tasty treats they serve up to marketgoers and cooks a lamb curry, while actress Donna Preston makes a vegetarian dish of spiced paneer skewers with mango salad

programme.title: Tom Kerridge Cooks Spain
programme.desc: The chef journeys from Extremadura to Murcia in his vintage food truck as he heads out on Lake Orellena to discover secret spots that are best for catching crayfish. He also cooks up a celebration of an ultimate take on a crayfish cocktail. Tom's journey then takes him to Murcia, where local producer Shelley shows him what it takes to harvest the Piel de Sapo, a melon loved in Spain and gaining popularity in the UK

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from York
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani and Ed Chamberlin present coverage of the fourth and final day of the Ebor Festival, including the 3.35 Sky Bet Ebor, plus races at 1.50, 2.25, 3.00 and 4.10. programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp, Craig Charles and Sam Quek attempt to answer 15 questions correctly in the hope of winning one million pounds for charity. They have lifelines including Ask the Host, Phone a Friend and 50-50 available to them if they get stuck. Jeremy Clarkson hosts

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.desc: After discovering that Simone's book is not purely a work of fiction, Hat grows nervous about the secrets it exposes and the repercussions of keeping the truth from Tess. Australian drama, starring Jodie Whittaker, Yael Stone and Helen Thomson

programme.desc: Fern meets the owners of beloved pets who have appointments at The Grove Vets in Bristol. Fern also meets the owners of a 10-year-old Cavachon who has to undergo orthopaedic surgery to improve her quality of life

When scientist Will Rodman's programme of drug experiments to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease is shut down he secretly takes an offspring from one of the chimpanzees he was using into his home and names him Caesar. Caesar has inherited the effects of the trial drug and begins to show remarkable intelligence, a development that will put him on a violent collision course with the humans who have abused him.
